snippet: New Hampshire’s primary is next week, but with Mitt Romney far ahead in the polls there, other candidates are turning their focus to the South Carolina voting 11 days later.
abstract: Mitt Romney is far ahead in the polls for the New Hampshire primary, leading other candidates to turn their focus to the South Carolina primary 11 days later; the southern state is emerging as an early crucible in an unpredictable political season.
lead_paragraph: New Hampshire’s primary is next week, but with Mitt Romney far ahead in the polls there, other candidates are turning their focus to the South Carolina voting 11 days later.

headline.seo: New Hampshire Is an Optional Stop for Some G.O.P. Candidates
headline.main: New Hampshire Now Optional for Some
headline.print_headline: New Hampshire Now Optional for Some
